intro: Tulipa connivens var. luteoguttata, commonly known as the yellow-spotted tulip, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers with distinctive yellow spots on the petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and produces showy, cup-shaped blooms in early spring. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique coloration and compact growth habit.
